entry.title: Part 1/2 of the PSL‚Äôs Lillian House‚Äôs interview with the...
entry.content:
Party for Socialism and Liberation - Denver

Part 1/2 of the PSL‚Äôs Lillian House‚Äôs interview with the Workers Party of Ireland

"The Party for Socialism and Liberation is one of the fastest growing socialist organisations in the US. In recent months, its members have been central in the struggles against police brutality and injustice. Earlier this year, four activists, including three members of the PSL, were arrested in Denver, Colorado for their role in protesting the police murder of Elijah McCain.

LookLeft spoke to Lillian House a PSL organiser in Denver and one of the PSL members arrested for her involvement in the protests, about her arrest, the massive protests that have taken place over the last year, and the broader political situation in the United States"

Activists from one of the fastest growing socialist organisations in the US were arrested in Denver, Colorado for their role in protesting the police murder of Elijah McCain.

lookleft.ie

The Price of Protesting the Police

Activists from one of the fastest growing socialist organisations in the US were arrested in Denver, Colorado for their role in protesting the police murder of Elijah McCain.Activists from one of the fastest growing socialist organisations in the US were arrested in Denver, Colorado for their role in protesting the police murder of Elijah McCain.

entry.title: Tune in tomorrow for analysis of the critically important...
entry.content:
Party for Socialism and Liberation - Denver

Tune in tomorrow for analysis of the critically important December 6 elections and the continuing fight against U.S. attempts to crush the Bolivarian Revolution. The outcome of this struggle is of immense importance to the people of Venezuela and all Latin America.

The livestream will feature speakers who have been on the ground in Venezuela during the elections including:
Gloria La Riva, Party for Socialism & Liberation 2020 presidential candidate
Manolo de los Santos, International People‚Äôs Assembly Kei Pritsker, Breakthrough News.

SAT, DEC 12

Eyewitnesses Venezuela

Online Event129 people went

entry.title: A major eviction crisis is on the way. Over half a million...
entry.content:
Party for Socialism and Liberation - Denver

A major eviction crisis is on the way. Over half a million Coloradans‚Äî16% of the population‚Äîare at risk of eviction when the current moratoriums expire. If we can‚Äôt pay rent now, how will we come up with the money when all that back rent comes through?

Temporary eviction bans are not enough! That‚Äôs why PSL is in neighborhoods across Denver and Aurora talking to the community about building the struggle for rent and mortgage cancellation.

Join a community car protest December 27 before January rent comes due to call attention to this urgent demand! ‚û°Cancel the Rents! Denver-Aurora Car Protest

entry.title: More than 8 million people in the country were unable to pay...
entry.content:
Party for Socialism and Liberation - Denver

More than 8 million people in the country were unable to pay last month‚Äôs rent. Come December 31, an estimated 520,000 Coloradans‚Äî16% of Colorado‚Äôs population‚Äîmay be facing eviction, when the moratoriums expire.

We need to fight back and demand that Governor Polis cancel rent and mortgages now! Temporary bans are not enough!

Join us for a community car protest on December 27, before rent is due on January 1, to drive through town calling attention to the urgent need for rent... and mortgage cancellation! Cancel the Rents! Denver-Aurora Car Protest

#CanceltheRents #CancelRentPolis

See More

entry.title: Did you know an estimated 30‚Äì40 million people in the US could...
entry.content:
Party for Socialism and Liberation - Denver

Did you know an estimated 30‚Äì40 million people in the US could be at risk of eviction in the coming months, and hundreds of thousands in Colorado? That‚Äôs why PSL members are hitting the ground across Denver and Aurora to talk to the community about building the struggle for rent cancellation.

The patchwork of temporary eviction moratoriums is not enough to address the colossal crisis facing the people of this country. When they expire and rent comes due, millions of people will suddenly be out on the street. The people need rent and mortgage cancellation now‚Äînothing less! #CanceltheRents

+2

entry.title: It‚Äôs almost 1, and the Aurora Civil Service Commission meeting...
entry.content:
Party for Socialism and Liberation - Denver

It‚Äôs almost 1, and the Aurora Civil Service Commission meeting is beginning soon. Get ready to call in!

Beginning next week, the Commission will begin private hearings to decide whether to overturn the firing of APD officers Erica Marrero, Kyle Dittrich, and Jason Rosenblatt.

Marrero and Dittrich, pictured left, took photos mocking Elijah McClain‚Äôs death at his memorial site and sent them to the cops who tortured and killed Elijah, Nathan Woodyard and Jason Rosenblatt.

...

Rosenblatt wrote back ‚Äúhaha‚Äù and was caught. He was fired for this incident and remains the only one of Elijah‚Äôs killers who lost his job.

These cops have demonstrated that they have absolutely no business patrolling our streets, armed, with the ability to decide if people like Elijah live or die. We demand that they are NOT reinstated!

Tune in to our stories for live updates during the meeting!

#justiceforelijahmcclain

See More

entry.title: ‚ÄúOn December 2, Governor Jared Polis released the second...
entry.content:
Party for Socialism and Liberation - Denver

‚ÄúOn December 2, Governor Jared Polis released the second revision of his executive order calling for a state investigation into the death of Elijah McClain. But activists are impatient for more than words. ‚ÄúWe are not settling for symbolism,‚Äù says Lillian House, a prominent organizer with the Denver chapter of the Party for Socialism and Liberation who is facing serious felony charges over demonstrations this summer demanding justice for Elijah McClain.

‚ÄúPeople in the street...s do move people in power,‚Äù House says regarding this new version of the order, then adds: ‚ÄúAt this point, it is nothing more than a symbolic gesture."

Keep up the fight! ‚û°Ô∏è‚û°Ô∏è Today at 1pm we are holding a call-in to the Aurora Civil Service Commission which will be hearing appeals for the reinstatement of APD officers fired for photos mocking Elijah‚Äôs death. https://fb.me/e/5NauFxUtB

See MoreGovernor Polis has clarified his executive order.

westword.com

Activists Want More Than Symbolism From Elijah McClain Investigation

Governor Polis has clarified his executive order.Governor Polis has clarified his executive order.

entry.title: BREAKING: With preliminary results in, PSUV and GPP coalition...
entry.content:
Party for Socialism and Liberation - Denver

BREAKING: With preliminary results in, PSUV and GPP coalition parties are declaring victory with over 67% of the votes for Venezuela's National Assembly, winning back the country's legislature from the right-wing forces which have held a majority since 2015.

Our task as activists and anti-imperialists in the U.S. is to struggle to demand: No Sanctions, No Blockade, and No Coup! Return Venezuela's wealth back to the people!

entry.content:
Party for Socialism and Liberation - Denver

On the ground in Aurora today üí™ With a major wave of evictions looming, PSL is hitting the streets to talk to the community about building the struggle for rent cancellation.

The patchwork of temporary eviction moratoriums is not enough to address the colossal crisis facing the people of this country. When they expire and rent comes due, millions of people will be out on the street, including hundreds of thousands in Colorado. The people need rent and mortgage cancellation now‚Äînothing less! #CanceltheRents

entry.title: Joel Northam and Lillian House, local organizers facing the...
entry.content:
Party for Socialism and Liberation - Denver

Joel Northam and Lillian House, local organizers facing the potential of decades in prison for their organizing for justice for Elijah McClain, are joining PSL Detroit and Detroit Will Breathe today at 1PM today for a forum on repression and the movement. Detroit Will Breathe has similarly faced severe police harassment and repression for organizing against police terror.

Tune in to hear from organizers from both cities who are battling this repression. Register for the webinar here:
https://us02web.zoom.us/‚Ä¶/register/WN_nDrht2iQRnuVsj_uNAxEUw

entry.title: Party for Socialism and Liberation - Denver+2Party for Socialism and Liberation - PSLIn the last few decades, tech...
entry.content:
Party for Socialism and Liberation - Denver+2Party for Socialism and Liberation - PSL

In the last few decades, tech developments‚Äìparticularly automation‚Äìhave transformed the economy in such a profound way that many are comparing this era to the I...ndustrial Revolution.

Some capitalist economists downplay the resulting loss of jobs, while others predict that such job loss is only temporary and will work itself out through the marketplace over time, similar to previous technological revolutions.

In both cases, they seem to forget the permanent unemployed produced by the Industrial Revolution, underestimate the potential impact of modern automation technology, and disregard the irrationality and anarchic nature of capitalist development. In many ways, the current ‚Äúautomation revolution‚Äù is similar to the introduction of machines in the Industrial Revolution, which radically changed capitalist societies by amplifying inequality, creating a permanent unemployed class that Marxists call the industrial reserve army, and intensified colonialism.

Today‚Äôs automation revolution will similarly transform the landscape of labor, as robotics, artificial intelligence, and machine learning make the automation of vast swaths of complex jobs possible.

The rise of automation will accelerate the growing inequality that we see today, where the three richest people in the U.S.‚ÄìBill Gates, Jeff Bezos and Warren Buffett‚Äìown as much wealth as the bottom half of the country‚Äôs population. Capitalism is a hopelessly outdated system, which has only preserved itself through violence.

We have witnessed the ability of socialism to thrive under far more difficult circumstances. Cuba and the DPRK guarantee housing, healthcare, education for all, despite being small, historically underdeveloped countries saddled with crushing sanctions.

There is no such thing as a ‚Äúshortage of jobs.‚Äù There is only a shortage of jobs that can be exploited for a profit. There is plenty of work to be done, and with socialism we could fully utilize the vast potential of the working class.

See More

entry.title: 51 years ago today, young revolutionary Black Panther Fred...
entry.content:
Party for Socialism and Liberation - Denver

51 years ago today, young revolutionary Black Panther Fred Hampton was assassinated by Chicago police. Hampton was just 21 years old, but his life was rich in struggle.

Hampton was a community-builder. He brokered a nonaggression pact between Chicago‚Äôs most powerful street gangs, urging them to turn their anger and guns around on their oppressors, not on one another. He created the Rainbow Coalition, a class-conscious and multi-racial alliance.

On December 4th 1969, the Chica...go PD drugged Chairman Fred, stormed his apartment and executed him in his sleep, along with Panther leader Mark Clark. Fred‚Äôs wife and son somehow survived the volley of 99 bullets. It was a military style invasion and execution.

This was not an isolated instance. This was US government policy.
Hampton‚Äôs murder was part of a pattern of police raids, false imprisonment and executions of Black Panthers. COINTELPRO documents proved that assassination of Black leaders was among its aims. Fred Hampton and the Black Panther Party had to be eliminated simply because they had touched upon capitalism‚Äôs greatest weakness‚Äîthe decisiveness and strength that a multi-national movement has in a battle against this system.

The Black Panther Party arose from the struggles of the African American people, historically the most oppressed and exploited group in the United States. They symbolized hope and received the greatest affection. They attributed Black oppression to the capitalist system, and dared to pick up arms against the state. The militancy and defiance of these young revolutionaries deeply impacted the Civil Rights and socialist movements.

Hampton and the Black Panthers believed all would benefit if the banner of the struggle against racism and national oppression was taken up by the white masses as their own. Hampton knew that it was possible to smash the racial barriers created by capitalism to divide and conquer the working class. His confidence was based on the strong belief that this system provides a motive for all to unite and engage in revolutionary struggle.

Long live the memory of Fred Hampton and the Black Panther Party!

See More+3

entry.title: More disgusting maneuvers by the city of Aurora to get...
entry.content:
Party for Socialism and Liberation - Denver

More disgusting maneuvers by the city of Aurora to get Elijah's killers off the hook üò° ‚ÄúWhat they‚Äôre effectively able to do is use the legal process to try to wear out grieving families with limited resources, but we‚Äôre not going away," said Mari Newman, lawyer for the McClain family. "This is an example of law enforcement and medics trying to continue to avoid accountability when they killed this innocent young man. And instead of doing what‚Äôs right, they‚Äôre using every tool..., filing every possible motion to try to beat this grieving family into submission.‚Äù

üí•FIGHT BACK!üí• Along with this maneuver by the city, the cops fired for the scandal involving photos mocking Elijah's death are appealing for their jobs back beginning next week‚Äîincluding one of the cops that killed Elijah, Jason Rosenblatt.

entry.title: DROP ALL THE CHARGES ON ANTI-RACIST ORGANIZERS IN THE DENVER...
entry.content:
Party for Socialism and Liberation - Denver

DROP ALL THE CHARGES ON ANTI-RACIST ORGANIZERS IN THE DENVER AREA! - HOW YOU CAN HELP

On Sept. 17, police agencies in the Denver area arrested anti-racist organizers in a coordinated assault. People were arrested in a Home Depot parking lot, at their homes, and after they were pulled over while driving. Those arrested were the leaders to demand justice for Elijah McClain, who was brutally murdered by the Aurora Police Department. They are still in jail, with the exception of ...one person. They are facing multiple felony charges and years in prison in an obvious frame-up aimed at stopping the movement for justice for Elijah McClain.

Add your name to sign the petition and join the campaign to demand that all the charges be dropped!

Petition text:

"I demand that all charges be dropped on anti-racist organizers in the Denver area. It is an obvious political frame-up aimed at stopping the movement for justice for Elijah McClain."

You can also donate for legal and political support for the PSL organizers who were arrested: pslweb.org/donate4denver

If you are a community leader or a member of an organization you can sign our solidarity statement: pslweb.org/denverorgsolidarity

If you can support in person, you can join our emergency demonstration demanding the dropping off all charges: https://facebook.com/events/s/dropthechargesco-march-and-ral/775179416359489/?ti=icl
